titleStmt.title: A letter sent to the Honourable William Lenthall, Esquire, Speaker of the House of Commons, wherein is truely related the great victory obtained by Gods blessing, by the Parliaments army, against the Kings forces, neer Newbery, on Sunday the 27. of this present October. VVhich letter was read in the House of Commons, and ordered to be printed. Hen. Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.

A letter sent to the Honourable William Lenthall, Esquire, Speaker of the House of Commons, wherein is truely related the great victory obtained by Gods blessing, by the Parliaments army, against the Kings forces, neer Newbery, on Sunday the 27. of this present October. VVhich letter was read in the House of Commons, and ordered to be printed. Hen. Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: Pindar, Martin.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons. aut

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: Newbery, 28. Octob. Munday. Martin Pindar, Thomas Herbert, Iohn Prickman, Stephen White.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
